result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:45 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Lloyd Edward Mitchell Jr. Defendant Lloyd Edward Mitchell Jr. not in court. Set for ARGN. Atty. Chapman is unaware of DE's whereabouts. State requests warrant. Court issues WARRANT - body only, adjoining states. Adjourned: 3:51 PM. kma
Filed by DA's Office. km
Filed by ADA Ballo. km
Arraignment on July 19, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Lloyd Edward Mitchell appeared. Case called at 11:01 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. ADA Becker calls Investigator O'Keefe to the Stand. S/T Michael O'Keefe. Employed with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA Becker. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record reflects identification. Cross by Atty Chapman. Witness excused. No further evidence by either party. ADA Becker requesting bind over. Atty Chapman gives argument. Rebuttal by ADA Becker. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Address confirmed. In person appearance. Court adjourned at 11:20 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Filed by ADA Ballo. km
